uniol.apt.analysis.bisimulation

Class Bisimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.bisimulation.Bisimulation

  • public class Bisimulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Check, 1. if there are two labeled Petri nets -> if the reachability graphs of two labeled Petri nets are bisimilar. 2. if there are two transition system -> if the given transition systems are bisimilar. 3. if tthere is a labeled Petri net and a transition system -> if the reachability graph of the Petri net and the transition system are bisimilar.
    Author:
    Raffaela Ferrari

    • Method Detail

      • checkBisimulation

        public java.lang.Boolean checkBisimulation(PetriNetOrTransitionSystem pnOrLts1,
                                           PetriNetOrTransitionSystem pnOrLts2)
                                    throws UnboundedException
        Check, 1. if there are two labeled Petri nets -> if the reachability graphs of two labeled Petri nets are bisimilar. 2. if there are two transition system -> if the given transition systems are bisimilar. 3. if tthere is a labeled Petri net and a transition system -> if the reachability graph of the Petri net and the transition system are bisimilar.
        Parameters:
        pnOrLts1 - The first labeled Petri net or transition system.
        pnOrLts2 - The second labeled Petri net or transition system.
        Returns:
        true, if the graphs are bisimilar. Otherwise return false.
        Throws:
        UnboundedException - if one of the given Petri nets is not bounded.

      • getErrorPath

        public NonBisimilarPath getErrorPath()
        Returns:
        a List of the non bisimilar path.

      • checkDeterministicCase

        private java.lang.Boolean checkDeterministicCase()
        Check if two lts are bisimilar. At least one of them has to be deterministic.
        Returns:
        A value of a Boolean. true, if the two lts are bisimilar. Otherwise false.

      • checkGeneralCase

        private java.lang.Boolean checkGeneralCase()
        Check if two lts are bisimilar. Both lts are nondeterministic.
        Returns:
        A value of a Boolean. true, if the two lts are bisimilar. Otherwise false.

      • getResultOfPartialDFS

        private Bisimulation.Result getResultOfPartialDFS()
        Check for the general case if the two lts are bisimilar in partial DFS.
        Returns:
        Result of the partial DFS

      • getSuccessors

        private java.util.List<Pair<Arc,Pair<State,State>>> getSuccessors(Pair<State,State> pair)
        This function determines all successors of the given pair of node. Therefore it calculates the direct successors of the first node of the pair and the second node of the pair applying the transition rules of the language. Then it calculates the direct successors of (first node, second node) of the pair applying the rules of the definition of the class.
        Parameters:
        pair - Pair for which all successors should be determined.
        Returns:
        A list which contains all successors of the pair. Therefore it is given the edge and the target pair of nodes.

      • getMapforPostsetNodes

        private java.util.Map<State,java.lang.Integer> getMapforPostsetNodes(Pair<State,State> pair)
        It creates a map with the PostsetNodes of a Pair.
        Parameters:
        pair - Pair for which a map with all PostsetNodes should be created.
        Returns:
        A map in which the PostsetNodes are the keys and in which 0 is the value for every key.

      • constructErrorPathPairs

        private java.util.List<Pair<State,State>> constructErrorPathPairs(java.util.Deque<Pair<Pair<State,State>,java.util.List<Pair<Arc,Pair<State,State>>>>> stack)
        Creates the path of pairs, which is not a bisimilar path.
        Parameters:
        stack - for which a List for a path is created.
        Returns:
        a List of Pairs of two Nodes, which is not a bisimilar path.
